results.title: The Story of my life: a film about Hans Andersen
results.creator_credit: Erik Witte, Jorgen Roos, Dansk Kulturfilm and Teknisk Film
results.brief_description: The life of Hans Christian Andersen. The son of a poor cobbler, he becomes Denmark’s national poet. The film reveals the strange childhood from which he derived the whimsy and fantasy of his fairy tales. As a boy of fourteen, he went to Copenhagen, bent on achieving fame in one way or another. He failed to impress the theatrical producers but obtained a scholarship from the King of Denmark. Soon he was writing short stories, plays, poems, novels and fairy tales.
results.title_for_label: The Story of my life: a film about Hans Andersen

results.title: The Story of Canberra
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of the events which led to federation and eventual selection of the Australian Capital Territory and Canberra as its capital city. Traces the history, landmarks, life of the people, and functions as the centre of the Australian Government Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: Story of Anyburg, USA
results.creator_credit: Clyde Geronimi and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: A town over-run with traffic hazards puts the cars on trial in an effort to stamp out road acidents, reckless driving and speeding. Automobile factory workers and highway engineers give evidence. The Defence Lawyer proves that an accident was the result of a speeding man rather than a speeding car. The newspaper headlines scream: “Autos acquitted…people admit guilt!”

results.title: Stop forest fires
results.creator_credit: Raymond Evans and United States. Forest Service
results.brief_description: In its appeal to everyone to take special precautions with fires, cigarettes, cigarette lighters, and matches, in forest areas,. this American film shows the shocking damage wrought by forest fires in the USA to forest lands, wild life, live stock, soil and homes. Narrated by Alois Havrillon.

results.title: Still in one piece anyway
results.creator_credit: Bruce Mackay, Ian McLaren, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film follows the Takaoka Maru, an enormous super-tanker carrying 1.5 million barrels of oil, as it ponderously winds its way through the Canso Strait to the oil refinery at Chedabucto Bay. It captures the intricate drama of docking and unloading the amount of oil Canada consumes in one day. Through an artful mixture of special sound effects, expressive photography, music and commentary, the film speaks both in awe, and in fear, of this creature of man’s making. A powerful documentary of a most unusual sort. Photographed by Les Krizsan and Barry Perles. Edited by Jy Chiperzak and Bruce Mackay. Sound by Raymond Marcoux and Bernie Bordeleau
